title: Real estate agent is arrested in child porn sting in Sydney
text:
Lionel Coombs (pictured), 51, appeared in Burwood Local Court, in Sydney's inner west, on Monday

A real estate agent allegedly told detectives pretending to be a mother he wished to perform sex acts on her and her 11-year-old daughter.

Lionel Coombs, 51, appeared in Burwood Local Court, in Sydney's inner west, on Monday charged with use carriage service to transmit/publish/promote child pornography.

The high-profile real estate agent was allegedly in August duped by detectives into believing he was speaking with the 32-year-old mother of the girl, The Daily Telegraph reported.

Police allege Coombs discussed sexually-explicit acts he wished to perform on the child as well as the mother-daughter duo together.

The 51-year-old man was arrested at a business in Strathfield about 9.30am on Thursday September 12 following inquiries.

Detectives searched a Strathfield home following the arrest where they seized several laptops and electronic storage devices.

Coombs was charged and granted strict conditional bail to front Burwood Local Court on Monday, where he made a brief appearance.

The real estate agent was part of the Richard Matthew Real Estate team managing West Tigers' legend Robbie Farah's $2.4 million townhouses in Wareemba, one-week before his arrest.

Farah has no involvement and is not part of the police investigation.

Coombs is no longer listed on the Richard Matthew Real Estate website.

The matter was adjourned to return to Burwood Local Court again in December.
description: Lionel Coombs, 51, appeared in Burwood Local Court, in Sydney's inner west, on Monday.
authors: Zoe Zaczek For Daily Mail Australia
